title: Hurricane Sally pours four months of rain in four hours onto Florida
description: Coastal Alabama and the Florida Panhandle face a daunting recovery Thursday, as ponds of floodwater and chunks of debris surround homes and businesses a day after a deadly Hurricane Sally walloped the coast with winds and feet of rain.

title: The painful absurdity of William Barr's slavery comment
description: Democratic South Carolina Rep. Jim Clyburn got right to the point when asked about Attorney General William Barr's comment on Wednesday that lockdowns to stem the spread of the novel coronavirus were the "greatest intrusion on civil liberties" in US history "other than slavery."

title: Why NASA is helping a beauty brand make ads in space
description: The International Space Station has served as the world's most unique laboratory for two decades, hosting hundreds of scientific experiments, crews of astronauts and even the occasional slime.

title: New reality show promises to send winner into space for 10 days
description: A planned reality show will seek to give the winner of its on-air competition "the greatest prize ever given out on Earth" — a 10-day stay on the International Space Station.

title: US billionaires' fortunes have skyrocketed $845 billion since March
description: Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates, Mark Zuckerberg and the rest of America's billionaires saw their fortunes skyrocket over the past six months during the coronavirus pandemic — while millions of Americans are now earning less than they were before the crisis began, according to a new study.

title: Trump pushes 'patriotic education' in speech rife with race-baiting
description: President Donald Trump railed against what he described as "the liberal indoctrination of America's youth" during a Constitution Day speech on Thursday, marking his latest attempt to inflame the culture wars raging in America ahead of the election.

title: Internal safety report sheds light on rare neurological condition suffered by vaccine trial participant
Nike's all-black Kaepernick jersey sells out in less than a minute
description: Nike released an all-black jersey to commemorate the four years since former San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick took a knee to peacefully protest against systemic racism and social injustice during the National Anthem.

title: Trump administration readies major arms sale to Taiwan
New TikTok deal keeps ByteDance as majority owner
Novichok found on hotel water bottle indicates how Navalny was poisoned, aides say
description: Russian opposition politician Alexey Navalny fell critically ill after drinking from a poisoned bottle of water in his hotel room in Siberia, his team has claimed, in a video posted on Instagram on Thursday.

title: The world's best underwater photography of 2020
description: Incredible image of sucker fish hitching a ride in the mouth of a whale shark scoops the Grand Prize in Scuba Diving magazine's 2020 Underwater Photo Contest, an annual competition celebrating the finest photography captured across the seven seas.

title: 'Very serious situation' in Europe, WHO warns
description: • Latest on Covid-19: Global cases have now passed 30 million

title: New York Fashion Week returns with socially distant and digital shows
description: It is looking to be a fashion month like no other. The coronavirus pandemic has upended the traditional runway format, and in its place a mix of virtual and, in some cases, physical shows with limited audience numbers has started to roll out.

title: Hundreds pose nude wearing only masks for art installation
description: Hundreds of volunteers have stripped and posed naked in a north London park -- all in the name of art.

title: Qantas offers a seven-hour flight to nowhere
description: With international flights restricted, Australian carrier Qantas is the latest airline to offer a flight to nowhere, taking in local sights to passengers paying up to US$2,700.

title: Spider-like venom found in Australian stinging trees -- and the pain can last for weeks
description: Australia is synonymous with venomous spiders and snakes -- but scientists have discovered new toxins in what they label a "truly venomous" plant.

title: US holds its second high-profile visit to Taiwan in two months as Beijing escalates military pressure
Barack Obama is publishing a memoir -- right after the election
description: Former President Barack Obama's long-awaited presidential memoir is coming this year -- but not until after the November election.

title: Joe Biden reminds Boris Johnson the world is watching Brexit
description: Joe Biden has provided UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson with the latest reminder that the world is watching how his government is handling Brexit.

title: Mohamed Bourouissa wins prestigious $39k photography prize
description: The French-Algerian photographer Mohamed Bourouissa has won the £30,000 ($38,673) Deutsche Börse Photography Foundation Prize. Since 1996, the prize has been annually awarded to a living artist of any nationality making a "significant contribution" to the medium in Europe, according to the foundation's website.

title: The best Indian food in the United States? It's in New Jersey
description: In a normal year, more than 60 million visitors will flock to the Big Apple. If they're craving Indian cuisine they are likely to end up in the eminent enclaves of Queens' Jackson Heights or an area on Manhattan's East Side known affectionately as Curry Hill.

title: Oldest animal sperm discovered in ancient amber
description: Scientists have found the oldest sample of animal sperm, concealed in a 100 million-year-old piece of amber.

title: The football factory where superstars are made
description: There must be magic in the water at Borussia Dortmund.

title: When does a good attitude become toxic positivity?
description: Between sleepless nights, diapers and feeding times, having small children at home could leave Priscilla Goins feeling exhausted. She loved her kids, but it was a lot.

title: Bacterial outbreak infects thousands after factory leak in China
description: Several thousand people in northwest China have tested positive for a bacterial disease, authorities said on Tuesday, in an outbreak caused by a leak at a biopharmaceutical company last year.

title: Al Gore: Trump is trying to gaslight coronavirus
description: Former Vice President Al Gore said that President Donald Trump is "trying to gaslight" the coronavirus, in a scathing assessment of the administration's response to the pandemic.

title: 'I don't know what to say:' Don Lemon reacts to Barr's remarks
description: During an event at Hillsdale College, Attorney General William Barr suggested that the calls for a nationwide lockdown to prevent the spread of the coronavirus were the "greatest intrusion on civil liberties" in history "other than slavery."

title: Only the US has more coronavirus cases than India. But unlike Trump, its leader seems immune from criticism
description: India is in crisis. Its economy has crashed, with the largest slump on record decimating millions jobs. Its already fragile healthcare system is buckling under the weight of soaring coronavirus cases. With more than five million cases, India ranks only behind the United States for confirmed infections.

title: Maine wedding linked to deaths of 7 people who didn't attend
description: Anyone thinking a vaccine will quickly end the coronavirus pandemic shouldn't get their hopes up. Instead, they should wear a mask -- which is probably even more effective, the head of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

title: Dr. Redfield testified that masks may be more effective against Covid-19 than a vaccine. The US President claimed he was 'confused'
description: President Donald Trump's own health officials continue to publicly contradict him when it comes to the coronavirus pandemic -- this time on the importance of mask wearing.

title: Floodwaters turn streets into rivers as Sally swamps South
description: Hurricane Sally restrengthened to a Category 2 Hurricane early Wednesday morning as it churns slowly along the Gulf Coast.

title: The coral scientist buying time against climate change
description: With her scuba mask on, slowly diving beneath the surface of the water, Emma Camp encountered a world she had never experienced before: an underwater city of vivid color.

title: Rochester officials intentionally delayed the release of Daniel Prude body cam video
description: The city of Rochester, New York, released 325 pages of internal emails, police reports and other documents on Monday that show a concerted effort by police and city officials to delay the release of incriminating body camera footage in the death of Daniel Prude, a Black man who died after police pinned him to the ground in March.
